subject: Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: Philadelphia defenseman Randy Jones was suspended for two games by the N.H.L. for his violent hit on Boston’s Patrice Bergeron. He is the third Flyers player suspended for a dangerous play this season. Jones’s banishment is brief compared with those of Steve Downie (20 games) and Jesse Boulerice (25 games). The difference is that the N.H.L. disciplinarian, Colin Campbell, said he thought Jones did not try to hurt Bergeron.
